required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Biomarkers for the Detection of Lymphatic Insufficiency
clinical_study.official_title: Biomarkers for the Detection of Lymphatic Insufficiency

brief_summary.textblock: Acquired lymphedema is a disease that causes chronic swelling of the limb(s). It is frequently under-recognized or misdiagnosed. This study is designed to lead to the development of an accurate, noninvasive, blood test to allow testing for lymphedema.

detailed_description.textblock: The validation of a sensitive and specific biomarker assay for human acquired lymphatic vascular insufficiency would represent a highly significant development for the patient community. Accurate bioassay for the presence of lymphatic vascular insufficiency should help to pave the road for future human clinical trials of experimental drugs and therapies designed to treat human lymphatic diseases. Molecular profiling will be performed in human tissues (skin) obtained by biopsy. The insights gained from these initial analyses will determine the targets for assay in human body fluids (blood).

primary_outcome.measure: Biomarkers for the Detection of Lymphatic Vascular Insufficiency

arm_group.description: Participants with a history of acquired lymphedema of at least 6 months' duration, will have tissue sampling (skin punch biopsy) of affected and unaffected tissue and phlebotomy for serum and plasma.
Participants who have undergone medical treatment that places them at risk of developing lymphedema e.g. lymph node dissection, radiation treatment; will have phlebotomy for serum and plasma.
Healthy volunteers; will have phlebotomy for serum and plasma.

intervention.description: skin punch biopsy of affected and unaffected tissue (upper/lower limb) phlebotomy for collection of plasma and serum, ~30 cc

study_pop.textblock: Patients who receive their care within Dr. Rockson's clinic in the Stanford Center for Lymphatic and Venous Disorders may be spoken to about voluntary participation in this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
For lymphedema participants:
history of acquired lymphedema of at least 6 months' duration.
For non-lymphedema participants with risk factors:
have undergone lymph node dissection and/or radiation therapy with no evidence of lymphedema
Control participants: no evidence of lymphedema, no lymph node dissection, no radiation therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
active cancer, infection or bleeding tendency

responsible_party.investigator_title: Allan and Tina Neill Professor of Lymphatic Research and Medicine
